newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble overnight rates rise in calm trade.
newsitem.headline: Rouble overnight rates rise in calm trade.

text.p: The rouble was little changed in calm trading on Wednesday but overnight credit rates had risen and dealers said the central bank could be behind the rise.
"Some banks were seeking roubles actively and it is quite possible this was because of central bank dollar sales," an Interbank Finance House dealer said.
Central bank's officials were not immediately available for comment.
Overnight rouble credits yielded 30-40 percent compared with Tuesday's late 1-10 percent.

Roubles for today settlement were quoted at 5,367-68 per dollar compared with an early 5,360-61 and 5,367-70 late on Tuesday. Tomorrow roubles edged up to 5,365-68 per dollar from yesterday's late 5,368-69.
The central bank said it had set 5,331/5,371 as its bid and offer rates against the dollar on Wednesday.
